DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of an other acute leukemia classification.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified._A clonal (malignant) hematopoietic disorder affecting the bone marrow and the peripheral blood.  The malignant cells show minimal differentiation and are called blasts, either myeloid blasts (myeloblasts) or lymphoid blasts (lymphoblasts).  According to the type of blasts present, acute leukemias are classified as acute myeloid leukemia (AML) and precursor lymphoblastic or acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL).__A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:leukemia in which the involved cell shows little or no differentiation, usually consisting of blast cells; two types are distinguished, acute lymphocytic and acute myelogenous leukemia.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

A clonal (malignant) hematopoietic disorder with an acute onset, affecting the bone marrow and the peripheral blood.  The malignant cells show minimal differentiation and are called blasts, either myeloid blasts (myeloblasts) or lymphoid blasts (lymphoblasts).

Property.preferredDefinition: Classification; the grouping of things into classes or categories.

Concepts.definition: A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified._A clonal (malignant) hematopoietic disorder affecting the bone marrow and the peripheral blood.  The malignant cells show minimal differentiation and are called blasts, either myeloid blasts (myeloblasts) or lymphoid blasts (lymphoblasts).  According to the type of blasts present, acute leukemias are classified as acute myeloid leukemia (AML) and precursor lymphoblastic or acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL)._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An acute leukemia of ambiguous lineage in which the blasts lack sufficient evidence to classify as myeloid or lymphoid.  (WHO, 2001) -- 2003

Concepts.definition: An acute leukemia of ambiguous lineage in which the blasts lack sufficient evidence to classify as myeloid or lymphoid.  (WHO, 2001) -- 2003

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An acute leukemia of ambiguous lineage characterized by blasts which coexpress myeloid and T or B lineage antigens or concurrent B and T lineage antigens.  (WHO, 2001)

Concepts.definition: An acute leukemia of ambiguous lineage characterized by blasts which coexpress myeloid and T or B lineage antigens or concurrent B and T lineage antigens.  (WHO, 2001)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: A clonal (malignant) hematopoietic disorder affecting the bone marrow and the peripheral blood. The malignant cells show minimal differentiation and are called blasts, either myeloid blasts (myeloblasts) or lymphoid blasts (lymphoblasts). According to the type of blasts present, acute leukemias are classified as acute myeloid leukemia (AML) and precursor lymphoblastic or acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL).

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

A clonal (malignant) hematopoietic disorder with an acute onset, affecting the bone marrow and the peripheral blood.  The malignant cells show minimal differentiation and are called blasts, either myeloid blasts (myeloblasts) or lymphoid blasts (lymphoblasts).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having a severe and rapid onset of symptoms with short duration. (NCI): A variant of systemic mastocytosis with involvement of the bone marrow (20% or more mast cells) and the peripheral blood (mast cells account for 10% or more of peripheral blood white cells). (WHO, 2001)

Concepts.definition: Having a severe and rapid onset of symptoms with short duration.

A variant of systemic mastocytosis with involvement of the bone marrow (20% or more mast cells) and the peripheral blood (mast cells account for 10% or more of peripheral blood white cells). (WHO, 2001)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

A clonal (malignant) hematopoietic disorder with an acute onset, affecting the bone marrow and the peripheral blood.  The malignant cells show minimal differentiation and are called blasts, either myeloid blasts (myeloblasts) or lymphoid blasts (lymphoblasts).
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
